com.beaglebuddy.mpeg

Class MPEGSideInformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.mpeg.MPEGSideInformation

  • public class MPEGSideInformation
extends java.lang.Object

    The MPEG side information follows the MPEG audio frame header in an MPEG audio frame. It is a required part of an MPEG audio frame, and is used by mp3 players to decode the mpeg audio samples.

    See Also:
    MPEGFrame, Section 5.2, page 24 of "MP3 Decoder in Theory and Practice", Section 5.1.2, page 13 of "The Theory Behind Mp3"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HEADER_MAX_SIZE
      side information is 32 bytes long for .mp3 files encoded with dual channels (stereo).
      static int HEADER_MIN_SIZE
      side information is 17 bytes long for .mp3 files encoded with a single channel (mono).

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • MPEGSideInformation

        public MPEGSideInformation()
        default constructor.

      • MPEGSideInformation

        public MPEGSideInformation(byte[] bytes,
                   int size)
                    throws ParseException
        constructor.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the raw bytes of an MPEG audio frame.
        size - size (in bytes) of the side information block in the mpeg audio frame.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if an invalid size is specified, or if the byte stream is smaller than the specified size.

      • MPEGSideInformation

        public MPEGSideInformation(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                   int size)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           ParseException
        constructor.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream pointing to the side information data in an mpeg audio frame in an .mp3 file.
        size - size (in bytes) of the side information block in the mpeg audio frame.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the side information from the .mp3 file.
        ParseException - if an invalid size is specified, or if the byte stream is smaller than the specified size.
